data.title: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust
data.meta_description: We offer a wide range of services for children and young people both in hospital and out in the community. Our dedicated and highly skilled medical and nursing teams offer a friendly and supportive service.
data.meta_site_name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust
data.text:
Our hospitals

Our hospitals in Grimsby, Scunthorpe and Goole provide services to a population of more than 450,000 people across North and North East Lincolnshire, East Riding of Yorkshire, East and West Lindsey.

Diana, Princess of Wales Hospital

Scunthorpe General Hospital

Goole and District Hospital

Community Services

We have a family-centred approach to delivering care to our children and young people who use our services, and parents are encouraged to be resident with their children should they wish to.

We hold outpatient clinics for a wide range of conditions and illnesses for babies, children and young people aged up to 16-years-old (19-years-old in some long-term conditions and complex neuro-disabilities).

We support babies, children and young people, together with their families and carers across North Lincolnshire and North East Lincolnshire to optimise their nutritional intake and support healthy growth and development.

The child development centre (CDC) is home to some of our childrenâ€™s therapy teams and a range of services are provided from here including parent and baby/toddler groups, assessments and therapeutic interventions for children under five with additional needs.
